title: Letter: Imposing Fees to Access the Twitter API Threatens Public-Interest Research

last_post.content:
On behalf of the Association of Internet Researchers #AoIR, we join the Coalition for Independent Technology Research's call for #Twitter to *not close* their free API access for vital public-interest research & ask policymakers to enshrine this form of access to all big platforms.

https://independenttechresearch.org/letter-twitter-api-access-threatens-public-interest-research/

@wmclark @pluralistic I first heard the word ‘enshitiffication’ from @pluralistic ‘s post from January of this year. https://pluralistic.net/2023/01/21/potemkin-ai/#hey-guys It details the process in general across most online sites, such as Amazon, MySpace, Facebook, and so on.

title: StreetPass for Mastodon

last_post.content:
StreetPass is a cool new browser extension that uses Mastodon's verification system in a clever way.

Mastodon users verify themselves by adding a custom link to their personal site. StreetPass lets you know when you've found one of these links, and adds them to your list. As you browse the web, StreetPass will build a list of Mastodon users that belong to the websites you visit.

I spoke with the creater @tvler about the project, 🧵 below.

Visit https://streetpass.social/ to try it yourself!

title: Stochastic Parrots Day

last_post.content:
Ok so. In light of much talking about Bing, Bard and "truth", I looked at what the "Stochastic 🦜" paper warned. The first 2 things, "automatically write term papers" and "interact on social media" have already come true. So....now do we just wait for the third to happen?

Plug for our event! With @emilymbender and @timnitGebru https://www.eventbrite.com/e/stochastic-parrots-day-tickets-524219965027

title: SolidGoldMagikarp (plus, prompt generation) - LessWrong

last_post.content:
This is all super weird and shows that we really have no idea what’s going on with these LLMs. Are we really ready for this stuff to become the backbone of internet search?

“We'll demonstrate a previously undocumented failure mode for GPT-2 and GPT-3 language models, which results in bizarre completions (in some cases explicitly contrary to the purpose of the model), and present the results of our investigation into this phenomenon.”

https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/aPeJE8bSo6rAFoLqg/solidgoldmagikarp-plus-prompt-generation

/via @clive

title: 02 | vectors & inks

last_post.content:
for my last semester at ITP I'm taking @shiffman's Nature of Code! but as a personal challenge I'm trying to do it all in #webgl ✨

so as a webGL newbie I'm trying to seek advice for this week's assignment: I'm trying to recreate dry brush strokes w/ ~30 "dots" (transformed in vertex shader) per brush stroke but that doesn't feel optimal/performant? should I draw direct to fragment shader instead?

here's the @observablehq: https://observablehq.com/@sxywu/02-noc-vectors

title: Childbirth Is Deadlier for Black Families Even When They’re Rich, Expansive Study Finds

last_post.content:
The New York Times gathered infant mortality data for California and documented the intense effects that racism has on outcomes

Babies of the wealthiest Black mothers were more likely to die in their first year than babies of the poorest white mothers

The whole piece is here; this is a “friend” link so you can read it even if you’re not a subscriber: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2023/02/12/upshot/child-maternal-mortality-rich-poor.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUyYiZ_tU1Gw5CRWySB4B99Vre37-WmvshnmT-KzTSQjZDy-hQBoGc9l3LbK4mYtwpwz2fRcNQdaUuT_w31uhYJQptVwys6NOiqagyHh8U-8i1T39kmNXMW6w16zbhcminJaBxneHm4EOLO33qD6ffzXFxcAt68pNhdUWq0SRelv2SG-9z2tJuzLx2UMABMDQHZiaBuPfrCwwve4nVK0GBtXRlHr1RSjrRntSD6rkfcA40CV7OSHJ34G9U-8oLcZpMf_65d0h8DZK41bYBCWVoLpOrBIkxQOXXk7ZtuL3PqX-c2a5Vh8QB9baqTnwJncGty80&referringSource=articleShare

title: Journalism is Lossy Compression - Whither news? - Medium

last_post.content:
Solid perspective here from @jeffjarvis. The post is about #ChatGPT, of course, but Jeff does a great job of putting that system in context:

"When we blame an algorithm for exhibiting bias we should start with the realization that it is reflecting our own biases. We must fix both: the data it learns from and the underlying corruption in society’s soul."

https://medium.com/whither-news/journalism-is-lossy-compression-86380f0bdb50

title: Does Autocorrect Make Life Better? - Towards Data Science

last_post.content: Des limites de la correction automatique aux limites de l'apprentissage automatique : https://towardsdatascience.com/does-autocorrect-make-life-better-aebafbed09f0 - La correction automatique fonctionne selon un calcul de probabilité pour choisir le prochain ou le bon mot d'un message. Mais ce calcul n'est pas sans lacunes, notamment quand il remplace un mot par un autre, sans nous avertir clairement.

title: compass.onlinelibrary.wiley.co...

Reflexivity is not just for qualitative researchers:
